docs.text: breakdown is an moderately entertaining , if underwhelming , thriller .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kurt russell and kathleen quinlan play couple jeff and amy taylor , taking the scenic route to california through redneck country .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , while in the middle of nowhere , their jeep decides to break down , leaving them stranded .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a friendly truck driver , warren ( walsh ) , offers to give them a lift to town .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although jeff rejects the offer ( he wants to stay with his car ) , amy agrees , hops into warren's lorry , and promptly disappears .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jeff wonders where the hell she is , and when he later catches up with warren and warren says he has never seen amy in his life , the plot thickens and jeff goes on a chase to find his wife .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although comparisons can be made with this film to deliverance ( 1972 ) and the vanishing ( 1993 ) plot wise , the latter two are far superior character and script wise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: kurt russell is o . k as jeff , although he can seemingly only pull of one expression , which is angry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: throughout the whole film , he looks angry ( or just pissed off . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: quinlan is o . k again , but again she can only pull off one expression , which is looking dorky .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: throughout the whole film , she looks dorky .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: j . t walsh ( who , sadly , recently passed away ) is fine as warren ( who we soon find out is a kidnapper ) although his actual character is pretty weak , and not really menacing enough .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the supporting cast do their best aswell , with rex linn as a doubting sheriff , and the other kidnappers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story , written by first-timer jonathan mostow ( who also directs ) is o . k , if surprisingly familiar and sometimes extraordinarily stupid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of the things the characters do in this movie is beyond the bounds of idiocy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are some flaws with the plot also , as the characters do the complete opposite to logical ( presumably to keep the story 'exciting' ) and also the fact that the story just isn't strong enough to sustain the audience's attention .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the picture moves along very slowly also .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it almost threatens to drop dead .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the picture does pick up towards the end , but by then it's too late .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mostow directs the action sequences well enough , however .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film doesn't really come to a satisfying conclusion , either .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the ending tries to be bleak , but just comes off annoying .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: breakdown could of been a far more enjoyable picture had it had a stronger cast and director .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , it just turns out to be merely average .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a missed opportunity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: overall rating= review by david wilcock
docs.label: negative
